intro: Lilium medogense, commonly known as the Medog lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing striking white or pink petals with a subtle fragrance. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
